thread.title: MKR scandal as Caitie and Demi use MSG in their food | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: MKR scandal as Caitie and Demi use MSG in their food | Daily Mail Online

author: Andrew Court For Daily Mail Australia
title: MKR scandal as Caitie and Demi use MSG in their food | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 125 shares 'We're the youngest in the competition, that might be a bit of an advantage for us,' Demi claims in the preview. Perhaps young and naive, the pair present their meals with Demi smiling and saying, 'The most controversial part of it was the MSG!' Jaw dropping: Caitie and Demi's rival, Cyn, looks shocked as the pair publicly announce that they have used the flavour enhancer in their food, effectively cheating Using flavour enhancers in food is strictly prohibited in My Kitchen Rules. After Demi's MSG announcement, competitor and rival Cyn's jaw drops in shock, as other contestants look around the table clearly stunned. Caitie and Demi have already caught the ire of Cyn and her partner Mell, with Cyn left feeling 'really sick' about their ageist comments. Not smiling now! Demi's eyes fill with tears, after getting into hot water for the including MSG Tears: Uni student Caitie wipes away tears as she's blasted by judges and fellow competitors 'We're not exactly sure what MSG does to be honest,' Demi says, as Caitie smiles nervously. The smiles are short lived, with the preview clip cutting to Caitie and Demi in tears, clearly in hot water for their use of the flavour enhancer. Drama-filled: The MSG controversy, to screen this coming Sunday, is the latest scandal from the series The MSG controversy will no doubt delight Mell and Cyn, Wollongong based businesswomen, who have described themselves as 'pretentious, stuck-up cows'. Caitie has called the pair 'old ladies' and 'Desperate Housewives' leading to tensions between the two teams. Young guns: Caitie and Demi, both 22, are the youngest in the competition
